Phone Apps for Carb Counting

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight
  • Print
  • Email to a Friend
  • Report Inappropriate Content

‎03-19-2012 11:03 AM

Wondering if anyone has a REALLY great phone app for carb counting? I just got a new phone and haven't downloaded any apps yet. I'd like to save time and put something on my phone that is diabetic friendly....there are so many apps to choose from!

Catherine

Helpful Response Given! Go to this response.

‎03-19-2012 06:30 PM

Catherine,

 

These are the apps that I use,

 

My favorite app is MyFitnessPal, it has an extensive food database and gives carbs, calories and all the rest of the nutritional facts.  I also have GoMeals, Calorie Count, Calorie Counter, Carb Finder,  and Fast Food.



-Sue
Type 1, diagnosed at age 38
OmniPod pump using Apidra insulin
Dexcom CGM

My adult son was diagnosed type 1 at age 4
MiniMed Revel pump and CGM
Apidra insulin

‎03-20-2012 05:15 AM

Hi,

I use Track 3 and Calorie King. Both apps are very good. There are other apps but these two apps have the most flexibility. The Track 3 app is the best though because it covers everything that is diabetes related.

a Deaf person with Diabetes.
